str2: Of Hebrew origin; properly, firm, i.e. trustworthy; adverbially, surely.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
No one, none, nothing.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
From oikos; properly, residence, but usually an abode; by implication, a family.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
Or heneken hen'-ek-en or heineken hi'-nek-en; of uncertain affinity; on account of.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
